Who We AreQvest.US provides business and technology consulting services that bring our clients closer to their customers, data, and content. We have a global footprint across five continents and are the largest Media and Entertainment focused consulting company in the world. We have deep expertise across Program Management, Digital Media Supply Chain, IP & Rights Management, Data & Analytics, AI/ML, Customer Experience and Salesforce, Cybersecurity, & IP Transformation.Who We're SeekingQvest.US is seeking an experienced Management Consultant to join our growing Data & Analytics practice. In this role, you will oversee projects that drive better data-based decision making for our clients, from strategy and planning, to data management, to analytics and visualization. We are looking for a hands-on technical data lead who can successfully manage projects, teams, and stakeholders.What You'll DoLead project teams through all core project phases, including project setup, requirements gathering, design, development, testing and deploymentLead your team through hands-on example by coding, creating data visualizations and building data modelsFacilitate workshops, provide status updates, and lead meetings across the executive levels of client organizationsProactively identify risks and issues, and provide mitigation strategiesMaintain strong client relationships while identifying opportunities beyond your current engagementContribute to internal growth initiatives including mentorship, recruitment, strategy and/or methodology enhancementWhat You'll Bring5-7+ years Project Management, Process, Implementation, SDLC, System Integration experience3+ years in consulting / professional services, big firm experience preferredExperience designing and building relational database and/or data warehouses on a major vendor platform such as Teradata, Redshift, Snowflake, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, MariaDB, or otherExperience with business driven or self-service BI, using tools similar to Tableau, Birst, Qlik, Cognos, Business Objects, or other5 years’ experience using SQL in a Production environmentExperience in data modeling using tools such as Erwin, Oracle Data Modeler, or ER/StudioAbility to profile, explore, and analyze data to identify common patterns and anti-patternsExperience with data migration, profiling, cleansing, and integration, including participation in at least one major data migration projectTrained and implemented in both an Agile/Kanban and SDLC project management environmentThorough experience with client-facing activities such as requirements gathering, meeting facilitation & presentation creation, and deliverable review & approval sessionsExperience with project planning, including tasks, budgeting, and resource allocationBachelor’s degree in engineering, information systems, computer science, business administration, or other related fieldsPreferred ExperienceA solid understanding of key BI trends and the BI vendor landscapeExperience in Media & Entertainment and/or Consumer Products industriesExperience at a large consulting firm (e.g., Accenture, Deloitte, EY, CapGemini, PWC)Life at QvestWe were founded on a culture of collaboration and inclusiveness, and this permeates each of our initiatives, both client-facing and internal. We offer a wide selection of benefits including medical, dental & vision, 401k matching and flexible vacation; we sponsor training to advance our teams’ skill sets and we prioritize our employees’ professional growth paths. Qvest.US is currently 350+ people strong and we’ve been recognized as a “Best Place to Work,” a “Great Place to Work,” “Fastest Growing,” and “A Jewel."Equal Employment OpportunityQvest is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Qvest applies this stance to all employment actions, including but not limited to recruitment, hiring, upgrading, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, recall, termination, rates of pay or other forms of compensation and selection for training, including internships, at all levels of employment.
